comment._content: ? also seen here [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/10394765015/in/photostream/] Looks like she might have appeared in 'The Idols' with the Harry Flockton Foster Company...vaudeville artists...seen here rusholmearchive.org/photo/harry-flockton-foster-comedy-co... rusholmearchive.org/harry-leslie-and-the-rusholme-pavilion more here

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Might have appeared on stage together (!) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/42399206@N03/4225729793/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: rusholmearchive.org/harry-leslie-and-the-rusholme-pavilion if you trawl thru this interesting history of the Rusholme Pavilion (Manchester), there's a pic of the Harry Flockton Foster Company which is dated 1909. Looks like Marjorie Neil might be sitting on the rh end...possibly Dolly Eales beside her...might need to do a 'footsteps of Beatrice Kerr' trip to Manchester just to firm up a few details on these pics. Here's the pic rusholmearchive.org/_image/dXcscA0b02_161360.jpg

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Absolutely think this is the same lady in our two photos. Thanks for the link to the history of Rusholme Pavilion esp Billy Manders. Kerr has quite a fascinating collection of signed memorabilia relating to performers in the UK at this time - more to come!
